captions.text: It's time for
Wonderful program for awesome people
The Samgyeopsal edition
Guys we had a roughy day
It didn't work As planned at all
No
If any of you guys follow us In our other social media sites
Like tmblr, Facebook, tweeter
We posted a bunch of frustrated comments about our batteries that died.
We were supposed to go wanking today
But I'm not sure what happened
I think we passed through Some small
an electromagnetic post field
Electric shock!!!
Because every single one of our batteries died!
And the thing is simon knows that we charged them
Because we've saw the green lights going on
And we were anywhere close near home
It said everything was fully charged
I don't know what happened!!
So anyways
Because we still wanted to feel productive
We decided to do a fapfap instead
Because it was way too late
By the time we got back from hongdae
With all the gear
We had to charge the batteries again
Yes
So instead of being home like this
We decided to go and cheer ourselves up
By going to our most favorite restaurant in Korea
EVER
We don't even know the name of it
We just call it the ajhuma samgyeopsal restaurant
I'm sure it has a proper name
But there is an ajhuma there and she serves samgyeopsal
And hence the name!
It's ajhuma samgyeopsal!!
There it is!
So before we fall asleep or die of hunger
Let's go get some samgyeopsal
And get drunk!
What? no!
Hello
I think...
samgyeopsal... Simon?
samgyeopsal
some Soju
And some coke
You don't need rice, right?
No
Oh she remembers our diet
So you can see that they didnt actually let us set up
As soon as we walked into the place
"what do you want???"
And they gave it to us before we could
Sit down and set anything up
That's because we come here all the time
Right
All the time
So we get it and before we even order what to eat
She actually even knew that we don't eat rice anymore
Not that we have anything against it
It's just not good for our diet
So she was just like "no rice for you, right?"
It was pretty shocking when we started not having rice
So in Korea you're going to see a lot of samgyeopsal restaurants
like... a lot!
They are very popular
And a long time ago we used to think that they were all the same
It was something like oh whatever
If it's somewhere cheap let's go there
We were dead wrong!!
This place got the best samgyeopsal I ever tasted
Even over the jeju boar
You know what I mean?
This is definitely better than that
So what to look for samgyeopsal to be better?
This is the keyword here "sang"
It means fresh samgyeopsal
And that all the restaurants that do it fresh
But it's not as good as magic place
I don't know
I don't know why
A lot of restaurants will give you frozen samgyeopsal
But I never had samgyeopsal this fresh before
So we said we were going to do a vegetarian fapfap
But then we got samgyeopsal
Oh next one was supposed to be vegetarian right
Sorry guys
One thing that it's interesting about samgyeopsal
Is that there is this different kind of pork that you use
So you're going to see these little white spots right here
This is kind of a cartilage
We happen to not like it ourselves
We usually cut around it
But supposedly some Korean people like to have the pieces of cartilage in their samgyeopsal
Because they like to chew around it
We are not that found of it
A lot of people like it
But we are just going to cut it out
Ohhhh so nasty!!
You know the samgyeopsal is ready when it's all gold and brown and delicious on the outside
Not golden black and delicious
Which was what we did originally when we came to Korea
It wasn't that delicious either
No, you ruined perfectly good samgyeopsal that way
Okay so there is couple of ways you can eat it this
Some people just take it and dip it on this side dish
This is sogeum
Which is salt you can just dip it in that way
There people will just take it and dip it in this ssamjang
Which is a bean paste mixed with a bunch of seasonings and stuff like that
And then other way to eat it is wrapping it really nicely in a sangchu sandwich
The sangchu is regular lettuce
And the ggaeneep is the sesame leaf
In this causes a bittery taste to it we happen to like it
At first we didn't
I'm doing it here we go
So I'm going to fold it in this lettuce blanket
I'm eating it in one shot, ready?
*Delicious samgyeopsal music*
If I can get Martina to stop eating for a second
Oh please go ahead
I'm  finished
Of course no meal of samgyeopsal is completed
Without a good bottle of Soju in hand
And that a lot of different varieties of it
We happens like this one
other people like other types
This one is our favorite because it tastes the least like poison
If you don't have soju with your meal they won't let you eat samgyeopsal in Korea
Hahaha
I kid!
Or do we...?
So we are going to show you this trick
It will make it a lot easier for you to drink
It will going to totally make your Soju taste delicious
And you are going to be amazed by the magic of it all
You will need to a few things for this trick
Number one a bottle of Soju obviously
Number two your shot glass
Number three a bottle of Cola
And number four a napkin
Take your shot glass
Fill it halfway with cola
So you are going to place your napkin on top
So That it is just touching the surface of the cola
But don't let it submerge
You just want it to touch the top of it
It gets a little bit wet a little bit transparent
Pour your Soju on top of it very slowly
Almost close to the top... okay good
Pull your tissue very very slowly, don't rush it
You want to be able to see it through
Then you will have...
A Very clear line
Between your cola in between your Soju
Now the beautiful thing about this is that when you finally take a shot
You're going to drink is Soju  first but the last thing you're going to taste
Is the cola so it's going to be sweet and delicious
So before you know you just had some Soju as well
So that's it for this week's edition of fapfap
Dad wholemeal was two servings of
samgyeopsal
One bottle of Soju, one bottle of Coke
the little bowl of soup
I ate all of it
She ate the most of it
And altogether costed 30,000 won
Which is 20 bucks or so
That is expensive for samgyeopsal
Because we told you we were getting fresh samgyeopsal
Premiums style
Very fresh not frozen
I got a little distracted because of the drunken people dancing behind us
I want you to know something really awesome
Right now it's about like 1:40 AM
And it's Wednesday night
And it's totally still bumping
Nobody seems to have any job
Seems that way! doesn't anybody have to work??
I want to get on my cane and be like
"come on everybody!"
"mumble mumble"
Everybody is just like walking around and eating samgyeopsal
They're probably going out of there at 6 AM and going to work anyways
Alright we are going to see you guys next week for our wank
For sure this time....
For sure for sure for sure
We are going to buy even more batteries than before
Simon look!
It's a samgyeopsal!
Go get it!
No!
Go get it!

comments.author: Lorraine Stanciu

comments.text:
Just booked my trip to Korea for this coming June and it'll be my first 
time visiting!! I just wanted to thank you so much for making these videos 
Simon, Martina, and the EYK crew <3 They've been helping me prepare for my 
trip on so many diff levels and I don't feel as scared as I should be for a 
19 yr old traveling alone to a foreign country. I've been rewatching all of 
your adventure/food videos and saving pins of all the places you've been to 
so I can check them out. Really makes me feel like I know the area already 
actually. Yay for no more living vicariously through your videos and 
finally being able to see all the awesomeness myself!! Another yay for the 
guesthouse I'm staying at in Hongdae being a mere 5 minute walk down the 
street from the You Are Here Cafe. ﻿
comments.author: Amy Pham

comments.text: +smile Atme Watching it right now, thank yah :)

comments.text:
+Sofia Abkari Your English is great! You even used an abbreviation! That's 
impressive! It's probably better than mine! I don't pay attention to my own 
grammar and I unintentionally use a lot of slang. There's a Korean market 
near me and I go there often. I just simply ask them to replace the beef 
with tofu! I guess I'm more worried about how "Americanized" the market is, 
if they will do that in Korea too and also the language barrier.

comments.text:
Always stay with my family on the farm when I visit, and every time I eat 
Samgyeopsal, I always visit a place near the place. So fresh and 
affordable. I tried Samgyeopsal in Gangnam..and the taste was horrible 
(frozen/thawed), and the price--couldn't fing believe it..5 big slices for 
100 dollars..what the heck! Supposedly, serves 2 people..but I could eat it 
alone and still be hungry haha.

Only went because of a date (and good thing it went well or 100 dollar down 
the drain =P.). Damn thinking about this Samgyeopsal..I want to be in Korea 
now; hopefully, I get to work there soon.﻿
comments.author: NerfPaladins

comments.author: jstyledipset

comments.text: +TheInunah That's probably the cutest analogy ever!
comments.author: Bibimbapski

comments.text:
+Marc Blair I guess I'm from a busier place, because most of the places 
near me have a sign saying that can't allow parties of one. Then again 
they're usually packed, and as soon as a party is done there's already 
another one to replace it. The only time I've ever seen them let some on do 
that is in the morning or early afternoon, because it's not as busy, but 
they give you less meat. I would like to also mention that there aren't 
many around me, though, and they've been getting more popular are here.
comments.author: Ma5jay5dontxdoxthat

comments.text:
+Ma5jay5dontxdoxthat it's true that people don't usually go to restaurants 
alone...but they wouldn't refuse you a table if you go by yourself...I've 
eaten samgyeopsal many times alone...most restaurants aren't packed as 
there are TONS of restaurants around so it's highly unlikely that they'd 
ever refuse someone because it's only one person.
comments.author: Marc Blair

comments.text: +Nayzau You're welcome
comments.author: Ma5jay5dontxdoxthat

comments.text: Thank you for the answer. I got it now...
comments.author: Nayzau

comments.text:
+Nayzau It does sound mean but when you know the reason why, it's 
understandable. The whole thing able bbq like this is it's suppose to a 
group thing/social activity, meant to do with two or more people. That's 
why the tables are usually so big, and the portion sizes match that. To 
restaurants, it is not reasonable to give a table on one person,, when they 
could just as easily get a party of 3 or more. EYK actually talked about it 
when they did their TL;DR on being alone in Korean as a new foreign student 
with Leigh.
comments.author: Ma5jay5dontxdoxthat

comments.text:
+Ma5jay5dontxdoxthat
 Why would they not?
comments.author: Nayzau

comments.text:

give you a table if it's just you.

comments.text:
When I was stationed about 5 miles South of the DMZ, in 1978, you could 
get, like, a 5 course meal for $3 American. I LOVE Korean food. Have you 
had JoenPone (spelled phonetically) . A HUGE bowl of spicy deliciousness 
with rice noodles, veggies, and sea food ?  I love that stuff. In my day, 
you could get a bowl of Ramen noodles with 1 egg for a nickle.﻿

comments.author: Jasmine Hwang

comments.text:
I made samgyeopsal-ish 'cause I was envious of the two of you eating 
delicious Korean foods! So I cut the meat samgyeopsal style but I oven 
cooked it for me and my brother and made a sauce made of strong soy sauce, 
sweet soy sauce, spicy vinegar and mild vinegar and added black ground 
pepper. I call Kuya (older brother in Filipino) Onichan (what I always call 
him because of me doing aegyo a lot recently while doing a cute voice). 
Onichan ate a lot of my meat without rice when I let him taste it 'cause he 
thought I already got my share! Silly Onichan! >_< The meat tastes delicous 
as well but it's not as tender and gummy! Probably because it was a little 
bit frozen when I cooked the meat. I'm eating this while watching you cook 
and eat samgyeopsal in this video. >_<

I actually like chewing the cartilage as well because I'm a Filipino and I 
find it yummy especially the pork cartilage and on the ends of the chicken 
drumsticks. I like gummy and non-gummy meat. :)﻿
